text: Elections to Liverpool Town Council were held on Monday 1 November 1871. One third of the council seats were up for election, the term of office of each councillor being three years. Councillor Andrew Barclay Walker (Conservative, South Toxteth, elected 1 November 1870) was elected as an alderman by the Council (Aldermen and Councillors) on 20 December 1871. ===No. 4, St. Paul's, 20 March 1872=== The death of Alderman John Hayward Turner JP was reported to the Council on 6 March 1871.
